title: India Partially Lifts Cellphone-Service Ban in Kashmir
text:
SRINAGAR—India has restored cellphone voice services to millions of residents of the Kashmir Valley, a step back from the near-total communications ban imposed more than two months ago, though an internet blackout is still in effect.

Service for cellphone users with fixed contracts had voice service restored at noon on Monday, according to Rohit Kansal, spokesman for the state government of Jammu and Kashmir. Service for cellphones with pay-as-you-go plans continues to be blocked, along with data and internet services on...
description: India has restored cellphone voice services to millions of residents of the Kashmir Valley, a step back from the near-total communications ban imposed more than two months ago, though an internet blackout is still in effect.
